title: Peter Crouch confirms him and Abbey Clancey are finished with having children
text:
The former England footballer said no more kids now he’s got four (Picture: Getty Images)

Peter Crouch and Abbey Clancy have four children – and now they’ve admitted that they’re ‘100 percent’ finished with having babies.

The loving couple, who are parents to Sophia, eight, Liberty, four, 20-month-old Johnny, and three-month-old Jack, have ruled out any more kids with the former England football star saying their family is ‘complete’ as they have no plans to expand their brood any further.

When asked if they’re done having little ones now, Peter, 38, said: ‘Oh 100% [we are not having another child].

‘It’s [Abbey’s] fault I think, she still looks great! I don’t know if we planned for four [children] but it’s amazing, I love it!’

The sportsman continued: ‘[To have] two boys and two girls, I feel blessed. Being able to take them to school now, pick them up and being hands on.’

As you might expect, the star said he has plenty of plans to get his sons playing football as soon as he can as he wants his brood to follow in his footsteps.

Crouch already has four children with his wife Abbey (Picture: FilmMagic

Unfortunately for him, his two daughters ‘aren’t interested in football at all’.

Too bad, Peter.

Speaking during an appearance on the latest episode of Red Stripe Presents: This Feeling TV, Peter told hosts Laura Whitmore and Gordon Smart: ‘The girls just aren’t interested in football at all, other sports yeah but not football so much.

‘I’d love to get the boys into it. I’ll take them to games and definitely they’ll be picking up a golf club and they’ll be playing tennis, as long as they want to.’

Sadly for Peter his two daughters aren’t into football (Picture: BACKGRID)

Peter retired from football after Jack was born, and previously admitted his decision still hasn’t really sunk in because of the ‘wonderful chaos’ of having a new baby in the household.

He said: ‘So this announcement feels a bit surreal. We have just welcomed our fourth child, Jack, into the family and the wonderful chaos that comes with a new baby means it hasn’t really hit me that I haven’t gone back for pre-season training.

They’ve just welcomed their fourth child into the world (Picture: Instagram/abbeyclancyofficial)

‘Life is hectic in a brilliant way.’

Peter added: ‘But I know there is going to be a point when it really hits me.

‘Football has opened up avenues that I never thought were possible when I started scoring goals in the Hayes and District league as an Under 10.

‘Football, simply, made my dreams come true.’
